title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
abusenius left at 00:11 (Read error: Operation timed out Enygma` joined #xwiki at 00:13 mflorea left at 00:25 (Quit: Leaving. lucaa joined #xwiki at 00:57 Enygma` left at 01:17 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds sdumitriu left at 01:54 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds venkatna joined #xwiki at 03:42 venkatna left at 03:47 (Remote host closed the connection venkatna joined #xwiki at 03:47 xwikibot joined #xwiki at 07:51 vmassol - (07:52): ok I've put it back vmassol - (08:03): ok I've manually deleted spam users created yesterday and today vmassol - (08:04): btw found a bug: there was a user created yesterday, I deleted it and now the user creation isn't visible anymore in the AS vmassol - (08:18): guys wdyt about http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/oded13 ? vmassol - (08:18): should we remove the tags they've added vmassol - (08:18): ? vmassol - (08:18): I don't feel comfortable with some of them like "sex workers" vmassol - (08:18): also they're not really about xwiki.org so I'm not sure if they're appropriate vmassol - (08:19): it looks more like advertisement vmassol - (08:19): so if nobody is against it I'll remove them vmassol - (08:19): actaully I'd like to remove the page itself vmassol - (08:19): since I believe it's pure advertisement vmassol - (08:19): the person has not done a single change anywhere in the wiki vmassol - (08:19): ok I'll remove it mflorea joined #xwiki at 08:23 vmassol - (08:27): lucaa: ping vmassol - (08:27): (I'm looking for a way to display all tags in the main dashboard) vmassol - (08:27): it seems the tagcloud macro doesn't have a param for this vmassol - (08:28): I see only space on http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/TagCloudMacro vmassol - (08:29): hmmm the IRC bot only reports changes on the main wiki now vmassol - (08:29): an api must have changed…. vmassol - (08:34): hmmm IRC bot worked there…. so it's working after all lucaa - (08:37): vmassol: but the tagcloud displays all the tags by default lucaa - (08:37): with no params lucaa - (08:37): {{tagcloud /}} vmassol - (08:38): lucaa: only on the current wiki lucaa - (08:38): ah lucaa - (08:38): well, there is no cross wiki implementation, yet :( vmassol - (08:39): what a pain to require PR everywhere for the dashboard lucaa - (08:39): why do you need PR? vmassol - (08:39): if I don't resave the pages they don't work vmassol - (08:40): lucaa: if you want to see it for yourself: http://watch.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Dashboard silviar joined #xwiki at 08:41 lucaa - (08:42): you should only need edit lucaa - (08:42): the macros are supposed to be current wiki level lucaa - (08:43): you don't need to save with PR, you only need to save with an existing user (XWiki.Admin does not exist, it seems) vmassol - (08:43): ok makes sense then vmassol - (08:43): it's because of thge import bug vmassol - (08:43): the issue created by jv yesterday vmassol - (08:49): jvelociter: you shouldn't execute live code in code.xwiki.org vmassol - (08:49): instead you should use an image vmassol - (08:50): otherwise when the live code is broken or we remove the underlying framework, the doc doesn't work anymore vmassol - (08:50): I'm referring to http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/RemoteCodeMacro tmortagne joined #xwiki at 08:50 vmassol - (08:50): (if we remove the remote macro from xwiki.org it'll break the doc) vmassol - (08:50): there's a pb with the stylesheet in 2.0 syntax btw sburjan joined #xwiki at 08:57 lucaa left at 08:59 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds silviar left at 09:01 (Quit: Leaving. silviar joined #xwiki at 09:02 silviar left at 09:02 (Client Quit silviar joined #xwiki at 09:08 vmassol - (09:11): tmortagne: is there a way to combine verbatim and monospace in xwiki syntax? It doesn't seem to work. Ex: ##{{{whatever}}}## vmassol - (09:11): I'm on http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/ tmortagne - (09:12): i don't see why ##{{{whatever}}}## would not work in theory vmassol - (09:12): maybe css tmortagne - (09:12): at XDOM level at least tmortagne - (09:12): should chek produce html tmortagne - (09:13): maybe it's because of what we generate around verbatim which is very bad IMO (pretty sure i created a related jira issue) tmortagne - (09:14): it's probably caused by the class used for verbatim yes since it's itself in a tt tmortagne - (09:14): so put anouther tt around it would not change anything vmassol - (09:14): jvelociter: how would you sort on the creation date in a livetable. For ex: http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/ vmassol - (09:15): (I see a defaultOrder but it seems to be for teh whole table, not for a given column) vmassol - (09:15): oh selectedColumn vmassol - (09:15): got it sburjan - (09:15): yes, I suggested that some time ago tmortagne - (09:15): vmassol: XWIKI-5047 tmortagne - (09:15): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5047 sburjan - (09:16): oh, so the bot uses swizzle :) sburjan - (09:16): to get jira issues vmassol - (09:20): ah actually it was correct…. fixing the example vmassol - (09:21): what does the tags param mean for the activity macro? vmassol - (09:40): jvelociter: how could I not have "emptyvalue" when there's no value? See http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/ SvenDowideit left at 09:44 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds tmortagne - (09:45): looks like hudson it totally unable to run any integration test SvenDowideit\_ joined #xwiki at 09:45 tmortagne - (09:45): ha "java.net.BindException: Address already in use" tmortagne - (09:45): there is some ghost apparently tmortagne - (09:48): should be ok now sburjan - (09:51): vmassol: shouldn't we try to preserve the same column name and column order for macros, snipets, appz, plugins ? sburjan - (09:51): where possible vmassol - (09:52): if you want to improve stuff please do vmassol - (09:52): but I'm not touching the classes now vmassol - (09:52): sburjan: would be great if you could work on improving xwiki.org too vmassol - (09:52): regularly vmassol - (09:52): ie every day vmassol - (09:52): bit by bit vmassol - (09:53): for example here's something to do: vmassol - (09:53): replace static lists with livetables vmassol - (09:53): the References space is a good one vmassol - (09:53): requires a custom json livetable result page vmassol - (09:54): but more generally speaking there are tons of stuff to improve vmassol - (09:54): and I don't see much happening on xwiki.org vmassol - (09:54): so your help would be welcome vmassol - (09:55): (I'm talking about improving stuff, gardening - not about documenting new stuff which you're already doing) vmassol - (09:55): (although we're still missing the new syntax page) vmassol - (09:55): (to document the new icon stuff) evalica joined #xwiki at 09:55 vmassol - (09:56): convert pages to 2.0 syntax too vmassol - (10:08): cool thanks evalica evalica - (10:08): np vmassol - (10:08): is that a pb in the default colibri skin? evalica - (10:09): not sure ... is a problem actually when are different sized avatars ... I must test more vmassol - (10:10): guys we need to find out why dashboard is still slow vmassol - (10:11): this makes it unusable on multi wiki sites vmassol - (10:11): hmmm seems my changes on the code wiki are not reflected on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Dashboard vmassol - (10:12): even though I have put: {{activity wikis="xwiki,platform,enterprise,manager,code,dev,watch,xeclipse,xoffice,contrib"/}} fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 10:13 vmassol - (10:13): hmm they are now…. is there a cache or refresh? vmassol - (10:14): ah I know vmassol - (10:14): I thought Activity was included vmassol - (10:14): but it'snot vmassol - (10:15): btw we need to fix this uphrade issue (next time we upgrade we'll loose the wiki list tmortagne - (10:16): guys in XWikiValidationStatus there is context.getWiki().parseMessage("validation\_error", context) but i can't find any "validation\_error" translation key in ApplicationResources.properties tmortagne - (10:17): any idea where it's expected to be ? tmortagne - (10:17): or if it's working at all ? vmassol - (10:17): too bad caleb isn't here tmortagne - (10:18): it's way older than caleb i would say vmassol - (10:18): indeed seems it's ludovic who committed this tmortagne - (10:18): caleb validation system is pure wiki page i think vmassol - (10:18): Author: ludovic vmassol - (10:18): Date: 2006-10-30 05:11:22 +0100 (Mon, 30 Oct 2006) vmassol - (10:18): New Revision: 1477 tmortagne - (10:18): i don't mean caleb is born that recently ;) vmassol - (10:19): I see ludovic added: vmassol - (10:19): +validationerror=Field $propName is incorrect. vmassol - (10:19): but he used vaidation\_error in the code tmortagne - (10:19): ha tmortagne - (10:19): so it probably never worked the... tmortagne - (10:19): \*then silviar left at 10:19 (Quit: Leaving. vmassol - (10:20): strange, his unit tests shouldn't have worked..... tmortagne - (10:20): looking if validationerror is still here vmassol - (10:20): :) tmortagne - (10:20): validationerror is still here tmortagne - (10:20): but if nobody seen this bug since 2006 i guess it's not much used... vmassol - (10:21): btw it's committed by ludovic but I see + \* @author jeremi tmortagne - (10:22): not sure what's best, i guess the safest is to add validation\_error to resources and remove it later with xwiki-core some time in the far future :) vmassol - (10:22): don't know if it's good to fix it tmortagne - (10:22): looking if anyone is using "validationerror" somewhere tmortagne - (10:24): yea maybe not but silviar joined #xwiki at 10:26 tmortagne - (10:26): so "validationerror" does not seems used camaritei joined #xwiki at 10:32 jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:33 j-saturne joined #xwiki at 10:40 j-saturne - (10:40): hi j-saturne - (10:43): since 2.6, xwiki failed to execute the chart macro with velocity variable (like http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SyntaxRepartition). Have you a solution ? rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:44 rrodriguez left at 10:45 (Quit: rrodriguez rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:46 tmortagne - (10:46): j-saturne: chart macro does not contains velocity in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SyntaxRepartition, the chart macro itself is inside a velocity macro as far as i can see so all the velocity is executed before the chart macro is rstavro joined #xwiki at 10:46 tmortagne - (10:47): i don't know what is wrong with http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SyntaxRepartition exactly but wiki macro don't support velocity as variable and never did, the velocity has to be resolved before the wiki macro is executed vmassol - (10:47): it's a permission pb I think on xwiki.org vmassol - (10:47): removing this page btw since I created another one in Admin tmortagne - (10:48): also as i can see in the error it has nothing to do with the parameter tmortagne - (10:48): "A Chart Macro using an inline source must have a data table defined in its content. " tmortagne - (10:48): which mean that the content of the chart macro for some reason does not contains a table vmassol - (10:50): we don't receive IRC bot messages when deleteing a page, strange j-saturne - (10:50): tmortagne : ok vmassol - (10:50): tmortagne: the page is now here: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Admin/PagesInXWikiSyntax10 tmortagne - (10:51): vmassol: i was not really trying to fix it, just answering  to j-saturne ;) vmassol - (10:51): I know vmassol - (10:51): :) sburjan - (10:54): vmassol:  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Admin/PagesInXWikiSyntax10 .. I can't access it, It seems it needs rights vmassol - (10:54): yes tmortagne left at 10:57 (Quit: Leaving. Enygma` joined #xwiki at 10:59 tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:59 tmortagne left at 11:05 (Quit: Leaving. tmortagne joined #xwiki at 11:08 tmortagne left at 11:17 (Quit: tmortagne tmortagne joined #xwiki at 11:17 sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:23 mflorea left at 11:24 (Ping timeout: 250 seconds xwikibot joined #xwiki at 11:36 xwikibot joined #xwiki at 11:42 rrodriguez left at 11:48 (Read error: Connection reset by peer j-saturne - (11:48): sorry tmortagne, but I don't understand how to use a chart marco with xe2.6 … I tested all config (xdom/inline, with/without velocity variable), but all failed on my xwiki. Perhaps a new variable in xwiki.cfg or in Preferences ? vmassol - (11:49): j-saturne: testing on xe 2.6 now tmortagne - (11:49): j-saturne: sorry i don't really know this macro, did you tried example on http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/ChartMacro20 ? rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 11:50 vmassol - (11:50): j-saturne: works perfectly well vmassol - (11:50): I took the sample from http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/SyntaxesDistributionChartSnippet vmassol - (11:51): and pasted it in a XE 2.6 page vmassol - (11:53): fixed vmassol - (11:53): oops vmassol - (11:54): evalica: sorry to bother you with this but I get a vertical scrollbar on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Features vmassol - (11:55): is it the same issue as on the home page? vmassol - (11:55): (on chrome) evalica - (11:55): vmassol: is because of empty paragraph in the wiki code vmassol - (11:55): where? evalica - (11:56): in wiki syntax there are break lines that generate emptry

evalica - (11:56): actually here is maybe because of the top edit section that goes under evalica - (11:57): the scroll whill appear when there are some negative margins on inside elements sdumitriu left at 12:03 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds j-saturne - (12:05): vmassol, in fact, snippet works good on code.xwiki.org (xwiki syntax 2.0 + XE 2.6), but the same code doesn't work own my xwiki :( … Can I find a trace/debug info to debug ? sabageru left at 12:06 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds rstavro left at 12:06 (Quit: Page closed vmassol - (12:08): j-saturne: since it's working on my local wiki I believe the problem is probably a permission problem to save the image in the tmp directory j-saturne - (12:08): :) seems to be a good idea ! I check that ! vmassol - (12:09): lunch time spliffy left at 12:16 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds spliffy joined #xwiki at 12:16 arkub joined #xwiki at 12:17 evalica - (12:26): hmmm... too bad that the colors come from the extension and are not overriden by the subwiki :P sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 12:31 rrodriguez left at 12:34 (Quit: rrodriguez SvenDowideit\_ left at 12:37 (Excess Flood SvenDowideit joined #xwiki at 12:37 SvenDowideit left at 12:39 (Changing host SvenDowideit joined #xwiki at 12:39 evalica - (12:51): sdumitriu: do you like how the color change for subwikis? :P rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 12:51 evalica - (12:51): on the download panel vmassol - (12:52): the download button isn't nice now. Are you experimenting evalica? evalica - (12:53): :) no - this is the best I can - because the colors get the location of the ssx, not the subwiki - so I don't have variables to change them vmassol - (12:53): I don't care about colors evalica - (12:53): vmassol: if you don't like it we can put the button back vmassol - (12:54): but the button itself is not nice vmassol - (12:54): I really don't like it as it is now indeed vmassol - (12:54): you can't even know it's a button vmassol - (12:54): looks like some header vmassol - (12:54): it's as if someone had broken the skin vmassol - (12:55): :) evalica - (12:55): k fixed - back to normal mflorea joined #xwiki at 13:15 sdumitriu left at 13:25 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds jbrBridge joined #xwiki at 13:26 cjdelisle` joined #xwiki at 13:26 spliffy left at 13:28 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds spliffy joined #xwiki at 13:28 kwoot joined #xwiki at 13:38 cjdelisle joined #xwiki at 13:38 cjdelisle` left at 13:38 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds kwoot - (13:38): Hi. using xwiki 2.6 when a page contains a png with width and height at 85% it disappears from pdf export. without width and height settings it show up on pdf export. familiar to anyone? jbrBridge left at 13:39 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds jbrBridge joined #xwiki at 13:39 tmortagne - (13:44): hmm maybe it's caused by the special URL when there is a size, mflorea WDYT ? lucaa left at 13:47 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds mflorea - (13:47): tmortagne: I doubt it. When width/height are specified they are added as query string parameters, but the URL is the same otherwise. In the worst case the query string parameters could be ignored, but they shouldn't prevent the image from loading mflorea - (13:47): let me try to export a page with an image with specified size mflorea - (13:48): wait, if width/height is in percent they are not added to he query string, because they are relative lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:48 tmortagne - (13:48): it's a same in view but is it generated the same way ? i.e. is it using the same code which is overriden in pdf export to make it local tmortagne - (13:49): indeed did not seen the 85% kwoot - (13:49): do you like me to make a jira ticket about it? mflorea - (13:50): kwoot: let me see if I can reproduce it mflorea - (13:58): kwoot: I put [[image:xwiki-logo.png||width="85%"]] in a wiki page and attached xwiki-logo.png to it. The PDF export is fine. j-saturne left #xwiki at 13:58 kwoot - (13:59): mflorea: strange. and both width and height? mflorea - (13:59): just width, let me put height also mflorea - (13:59): what did you put? so that I use the same kwoot - (13:59): mflorea: one sec. fmancinelli left at 14:02 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds kwoot - (14:03): mfloreau  => [[image:[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)||height="85%" width="85%"]]       [[image:schets2v4.png]] kwoot - (14:03): maybe the Home@ screws things up? mflorea - (14:04): I don't think so, if Home is a page in the same space then it's fine kwoot - (14:06): So this: [[image:[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)||height="85%" width="85%"]]  does not give picture in pdf. mflorea - (14:10): kwoot: it's definitely because of the height, which I think doesn't make sense when you export as PDF. If you specify width/height in percent, they are relative to the container width/height. 85% of 0 height is 0. Maybe when you export as PDF the page height is unknown (so 0) and thus the computed image height is 0. I don't have other explanation. mflorea - (14:11): wait, ignore me, I thought of something else, when percent is specified on image, it's from the original size mflorea - (14:11): so it should work kwoot - (14:11): so what's next? shall I make a ticket in Jira or do you want additional input? mflorea - (14:13): hmm, actually I just checked and I was right, it's 85% of the page height not the original image height. mflorea - (14:13): kwoot: why do you need to specify the height sabageru joined #xwiki at 14:13 kwoot - (14:14): No, not me, a user resized his uploaded picture using width and height settings. mflorea - (14:14): I see mflorea - (14:15): go ahead and open a jira issue kwoot - (14:15): the uploaded picture is to big to fit on the screen and the default skin does not seem to allow for horizontal scroll bars at the bottom when the content is too wide. mflorea - (14:16): sure, but it's enough to resize the width because the height is resized automatically mflorea - (14:16): it's always better to specify just one dimensions so that image aspect ratio is preserved mflorea - (14:16): so either width or height, but width it better kwoot - (14:23): jira ticket made: XWIKI-5726 kwoot - (14:24): In the mean time, I will inform my user that only width should work since xwiki keeps the aspect ratio the same. venkatna left at 14:25 (Remote host closed the connection rrodriguez left at 14:30 (Quit: rrodriguez jstoldt joined #xwiki at 14:39 jstoldt - (14:39): hi jstoldt - (14:39): i got a problem with the OOo server function jstoldt - (14:39): it fails not just to start on 2.6 jstoldt - (14:40): but trying to start it from admin panel gives me an error jstoldt - (14:41): http://pastebin.ca/2001968 jstoldt - (14:41): error log when starting the server^^ jstoldt - (14:42): trying to connect makes this log appear on the page: http://pastebin.ca/2001969 vmassol - (14:42): templateProfileDir must exist and be a directory vmassol - (14:42): so does it point to a dir? jstoldt - (14:43): server log for this: http://pastebin.ca/2001971 jstoldt - (14:43): i can't see any dir jstoldt - (14:43): and it used to work on 2.5 jstoldt - (14:46): no changes done on the OOo installation vmassol - (14:47): this is the profilePath config vmassol - (14:47): openoffice.profilePath jstoldt - (14:47): oh, just remembered something vmassol - (14:47): make sure it points to a dir and that you have write access to it jstoldt - (14:47): yep, that might indeed be the problem! jstoldt - (14:47): i changed tomcat there vmassol - (14:49): snowing heavily here….. ;) jstoldt - (14:49): it stopped here for the moment... i don't like snow sburjan - (14:49): jstoldt: I tested with 2.6 and it works (Using ubuntu) jstoldt - (14:50): yeah, i figure it's my bad jstoldt - (14:50): i changed the logon settings of tomcat sburjan - (14:50): you're using win or linux ? jstoldt - (14:50): so it's now running under a different user jstoldt - (14:50): nope, win 7 sburjan - (14:50): oh jstoldt - (14:50): you put me back on track sburjan - (14:50): check the default install path of OO on documentation, and modify it in the proprieties file jstoldt - (14:50): fixed it :) sburjan - (14:50): great :) cjdelisle is now known as cjdelisle` ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) sburjan left at 14:53 (Quit: Ex-Chat rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 14:53 cjdelisle` left at 14:57 (Changing host cjdelisle` joined #xwiki at 14:57 cjdelisle` left at 15:01 (Quit: oops wrong button jbrBridge left at 15:01 (Remote host closed the connection jbrBridge joined #xwiki at 15:05 cjdelisle` joined #xwiki at 15:05 silviar left at 15:14 (Read error: Connection reset by peer jstoldt - (15:23): i still got huge trouble with attachments jstoldt - (15:23): and i really can not figure out what is causing them cjdelisle` - (15:23): What's the problem? jstoldt - (15:24): just now i tried to delete a series of jpgs created from the importer and got the following message for each one of them in tomcat log jstoldt - (15:24): 2010-11-25 15:20:39,290 [http://localhost/bin/delete/Konstruktionsrichtlinien/Zeichnungserstellung?confirm=1&form\_token=50KsAtCot8FZmmYw40wyfA] WARN  doc.XWikiAttachment             - Failed to load content for attachment [ZeichnungserstellungRichtl-slide7.jpg@Konstruktionsrichtlinien.Zeichnungserstellung]. This attachment is broken, please consider re-uploading it. Internal error: Error number 3231 in 3: Exception while loading atta jstoldt - (15:24): no wait jstoldt - (15:24): 2010-11-25 15:08:10,177 [http://de-w-0156852.de.abb.com/bin/delete/Konstruktionsrichtlinien/Zeichnungserstellung?confirm=1&form\_token=WGK5t6dPFjzDnMNS46eotA] WARN  doc.XWikiAttachment             - Failed to load content for attachment [ZeichnungserstellungRichtl-slide3.jpg@Konstruktionsrichtlinien.Zeichnungserstellung]. This attachment is broken, please consider re-uploading it. Internal error: Error number 3231 in 3: Exception whil jstoldt - (15:24): this jstoldt - (15:24): and it wouldn't delete them jstoldt - (15:25): "of document Konstruktionsrichtlinien.Zeichnungserstellung Wrapped Exception: No row with the given identifier exists: [com.xpn.xwiki.doc.XWikiAttachmentContent#-614822186] " is the end cjdelisle` - (15:25): That's right. I had been meaning to change that exception so the root cause is not hidden. jstoldt - (15:25): that'd help a lot jstoldt - (15:25): because, also, i sometimes can't upload new versions of attachments jstoldt - (15:26): or the attachement will loose previous versions cjdelisle` - (15:26): What version of the wiki are you using? jstoldt - (15:26): someone suggested it's about postgresql but i don't see what could be causing this if i use out of the box postgres... jstoldt - (15:26): i use 2.6 now but it was the same in 2.5 jstoldt - (15:26): and 2.5.1 cjdelisle` - (15:27): Nope. I use postgress as well so it's not that. jstoldt - (15:28): it's really weird jstoldt - (15:28): i tried creating new databases twice without any improvement cjdelisle` - (15:28): There is a - in the name. I thought those were removed automatically. jstoldt - (15:28): only \_ iirc lynxt joined #xwiki at 15:29 lynxt - (15:29): hi everyone jstoldt - (15:29): just now it was like this, i imported a ppt, it created a couple of png's, i then decided to go with the viewer macro, changed the wiki text accordingly, then tried to delete the attached images cjdelisle` - (15:29): starting my wiki engine, I'll spend some time in this. cjdelisle` - (15:30): Can you attach \_anything\_ without having trouble? jstoldt - (15:30): it said the deletion went alright but instead of deleting the attachment it cleared the wiki code jstoldt -
